intro: Stachys durandiana, commonly known as the Himalayan betony, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem, producing violet to purple blooms that attract pollinators. Stachys durandiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses in local herbal practices.
